intro: Neottia flexuosa, commonly known as the flexible twayblade, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to various regions of Europe and Asia. It is a small, herbaceous plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wet meadows. The plant has a distinctive appearance with two elongated leaves and a slender stem that bears a single, inconspicuous flower. Neottia flexuosa is known for its ability to form symbiotic relationships with mycorrhizal fungi, which aid in nutrient absorption. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
